result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel Lopez Santiago

records.addlTxt: WCS report dated November 3, 2022 re: Failure to Report. Received and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Miguel Lopez Santiago
Current: 106 Elm Street #2A, Pewaukee, WI 53072 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

10/14/22:  Court converts the cash bond to a signature bond.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released.  Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment (35 hours per week) withing the first 30 days of release.

9:31 AM Defendant Miguel Lopez Santiago in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Miguel Lopez Santiago.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for bail/bond hearing.
Arguments by the Defense.
Objections by the State.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court grants the motion to modify bond.
Court orders cash bond converted to a signature bond in the amount of $1500.00.  All conditions previously set to remain and the Court adds: Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment (35 hours per week) withing the first 30 days of release.
Defense requests one further proceedings before setting this matter for trial. 
Court will set this matter for trial.
Jury trial expected to last 2 days.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Each side is entitled to 5 strikes.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on January 19, 2023 at 09:30 am.

10:25 AM Defendant Miguel Lopez Santiago in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Miguel Lopez Santiago.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests time to work on a possible immigration issue.
Defense intends to file a bail motion and requests a hearing be set in a couple of weeks.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification, filed by Atty. Miller
Hearing on September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:04 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Miguel Lopez Santiago in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Luis Gutierrez, for attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he is requesting another further proceedings date in about 60 days as they are waiting on an offer.  Atty. Nickolie notes there is an offer and will email to Atty. Miller.  Court notes there is no amended information in the file yet reflecting the blood test results.  Atty. Nickolie will e-file the amended information now.  Atty. Gutierrez notes he would prefer to have the attorney assigned to the case enter the formal plea with respect to the amended inforamtion.  Court will accept the amended information filed by the State and enter the initial not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant noting that he will reserve any Jurisdictional challanges for Atty. Miller until the next court date.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:28 AM Defendant Miguel Lopez Santiago in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Cassandra Miller
Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:37 PM Defendant Miguel Lopez Santiago in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Bail remains as fixed.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing on May 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:22 AM Defendant Miguel Lopez Santiago in court, in custody.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for a Status of Counsel.
The Defendant states he sent jail mail to SPD on May 05, 2022, but has yet to hear from them.
The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The Court notes that it found an SPD attorney and put the Defendant on the list to be evaluated. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The Court adjourns.  Hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:47 AM Defendant Miguel Lopez Santiago in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Defendant is trying to get his ICE hold off and requests an adjournment to see if he can bail out.
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to an attorney.
The Court finds that the Defendant is freely, knowingly, and voluntarily asking for an adjournment, not having an attorney at this time and tolling the time limits for a prelim hearing.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:12 PM Defendant Miguel Lopez Santiago in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern, Taylor Olson.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Alyssa Jay, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.

The Court puts the Defendant on notice that any WCS non-compliance letter filed, the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
The Court order the Defendant a phone call from Waueksha County Jail.  Hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
